GWFdata 0.1.0.9000
  • Reference
    • Replicating the Latent Variable Estimates of Personalism, Party Autonomy, and Military Autonomy in Wright 2019

Simplified dataset from Weeks 2014

Source: R/data_documentation.R
weeks.Rd

This is a subset of the data used in Jessica L. Weeks, 2014. Dictators at War and Peace. Cornell University Press. The actual dataset is taken from the replication data posted at https://www.jessicalpweeks.com/research.html

Usage

weeks

Format

An object of class tbl_df (inherits from tbl, data.frame) with 7485 rows and 15 columns.

Variables

extended_country_name

The full name of the country.

GWn

Gleditsch-Ward country code.

cown

Correlates of War numeric country code.

ccode1

Alternative country code for some analysis.

year

The year of the observation.

abbrev1

Abbreviation for the country name.

demjlw_2014_1

Binary indicator for democratic regimes, based on Weeks (2014) coding.

juntajlw_2014_1

Binary indicator for military junta regimes, based on Weeks (2014) coding.

strongmanjlw_2014_1

Binary indicator for strongman regimes, based on Weeks (2014) coding.

machinejlw_2014_1

Binary indicator for machine regimes, based on Weeks (2014) coding.

bossjlw_2014_1

Binary indicator for boss regimes, based on Weeks (2014) coding.

regimejlw_2014_1

Categorical variable indicating regime type, based on Weeks (2014) coding.

militarygeddes_2014_1

Binary indicator for military regimes, based on Geddes, Wright, and Frantz (2014).

personalgeddes_2014_1

Binary indicator for personalist regimes, based on Geddes, Wright, and Frantz (2014).

in_GW_system

Binary indicator for whether the country is in the Gleditsch-Ward system for the year.

References

Jessica L. Weeks. 2014. Dictators at War and Peace. Cornell University Press. Barbara Geddes, Joseph Wright, and Erica Frantz. 2014. "Autocratic Regimes: A New Data Set." Perspectives on Politics 12(2):313-331.
